subject: Re: [junit] Create a dynamic suite of tests
msgSnippet: You can use ant (and possibly the antcontrib if task) to drive your unit tests:  ...
messageBody:
You can use ant (and possibly the antcontrib 'if' task) to drive your unit tests:

<project name="mytestsuite" default="all" >
...
<taskdef resource="net/sf/antcontrib/antcontrib.properties"
classpath="${ant_contrib_cp}" />
...
<target name="all" depends="first_bank_of_tests,second_bank_of_tests,...,build_reports" />

<target name="first_bank_of_tests">
<junit printsummary="false" errorProperty="test.failed"
fork="true" failureProperty="test.failed">
<classpath refid="xxx.cp"/>
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/>
<formatter type="xml"/>
<test todir="${results.data}" name="com.mypackage.FirstTest"/>
</junit>
<fail message="first_bank_of_tests failed" if="test.failed"/>
</target>
...
<target name="second_bank_of_tests">
<junit printsummary="false" errorProperty="test.failed"
fork="true" failureProperty="test.failed">
<classpath refid="xxx.cp"/>
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/>
<formatter type="xml"/>
<test todir="${results.data}" name="com.mypackage.SecondTest"/>
</junit>
<if>
<isset property="test.failed"/>
<then>
<antcall target="first_bank_of_tests"/>
</then>
</if>
</target>
...
<target name="build_reports" >
<junitreport todir="${results.data}">
<fileset dir="${results.data}">
<include name="TEST-*.xml" />
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="${results.reports}" />
</junitreport>
</target>
../
</project>
